tags: steve x bucky x tony x clint
summary: Every considered Bucky x Steve x Tony x Clint???? It’s a cute ship I found that’s pretty small on AO3. If you’d like to write...
question: Every considered Bucky x Steve x Tony x Clint???? It’s a cute ship I found that’s pretty small on AO3. If you’d like to write for them, I have a prompt! Laser tag shenanigans where everyone cheats in their own way and I insists they didn’t cheat because x y and z reason
answer:
Of course Clint was the one who suggested the laser tagging. “It’s the best date idea ever! Right next to carnival games.”

“Clint you’re literally the only person in the world who wins every time.”

“What can I say? I used to work the booths, I know all the secrets.”

“Also you’re Hawkeye.”

“That too.”

“Steve and Bucky get the final say.” Tony shrugged. “They probably don’t even know what we’re talking about.”

“We do not,” Steve said. “But it sure is fascinating to watch.”

“Does laser tag involve lasers?” Bucky interrupted. “Because if it does then I’m in. No questions asked.”

So they went laser tagging. It was a mess.

Tony somehow managed to hack into their guns in the first round, making him the automatic winner when they weren’t able to shoot him at all.

“I’m just using my avantages!” Tony protested, when accused of cheating.

The poor worker looked frazzled. “Um. Would you guys like to go again?”

They made him swear not to do that for the rest of the games (because just one wouldn’t cut it, obviously).

They decided to do teams for the next game, humans against super soldiers. Bucky ‘incapacitated’ Clint by pinning him up against the wall and whispering seductively dirty secrets in his ear and shot him. Tony was no match for the super soldiers on his own, so they won round two.

“There’s nothing in the rules that says no seduction,” Bucky insisted. “I was totally allowed to do that.”

“You’re just sore because I didn’t try and seduce you too, aren’t you, sweetheart?” Steve bent down and whispered something NSFLT (not safe for laser tagging) in his ear. “Better?”

Tony shivered and melted a little before recovering his glare. “No! Added to our rules: If I can’t hack into shit, none of us can use out power of seduction. Old fashioned laser tagging only.”

“Technically there’s supposed to be no physical  contact between players,” The worker spoke up. She looked like she was about to pass out.

“Ha!” Clint said smugly.

“Don’t sound all superior, your weakness is what brought us down.” Tony scowled.

On their third and final round, A free-for-all, Clint won. “The game as it should be played!” He crowed proudly.

Technically he hadn’t cheated but … he was Hawkeye.

“Well we all did win a round,” Steve mused. “We should reward ourselves.”

“There’s an ice cream parlor next door,” The attendant offered. “Um.” She let out a squeaky cough. “Could I get your autographs?”

“Of course!” Tony said generously. They left her with all the signatures she could want, and a $500 tip for putting up with them. They waved away her stammered protests and thanks. She deserved it.

“You know,” Bucky said, once they’d bought their ice cream and were taking turns trying to make the others blush with saucy licking motions, “I’m kinda disappointed that they consider those things lasers. They don’t even kill you.”

Tony got a concerning glint in his eyes.

“You are not making us a real laser laser tag course,” Steve said sternly.

“Aww, but Bucky Nat and I would love that,” Clint said with a pout. “Don’t listen to him Tony, you can do whatever you want. It’s your tower.”

Steve smiled calmly, handed Bucky his ice cream, and scooped both of his disaster boyfriends with no regard for their own personal safety into each arm. “No.”

title: Hold On, To Me As We Go.
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2VuyWtn

by GLWilliams97

It may have been 30 years, give or take, since he met his best friend, but he’d never forget the first time that he met the skinny little kid that had a busted lip because he had mouthed off to one of the much older students.
He’d never forget that little face.
The face that he was suddenly seeing all over again…sat next to his best friend.

—
Yes, this is one of those stories where Tony find’s out Peter is actually his son. I’m a sucker for these kind of stories and I’ve wanted to write one for a while…so, here it is :)

tags: what’s with all these anons lately?
summary: so i love tony and all but like i was happy with his ending. it was character development for him to put others above himself in...
question: so i love tony and all but like i was happy with his ending. it was character development for him to put others above himself in making the ultimate sacrifice... finally. so why are you so bitter about endgame? we technically lost multiple characters, not just him.
answer:
Greetings, courageous Anon,

Okay so…. I’ve been bitter about Endgame? Is that so? I mean, I’ve had my gripes about it, but ultimately I enjoyed it and thought it was a good movie. I even look forward to watching it again.

Now as for Tony…. I think his ending did him justice. He went out as the greatest of the Avengers. I just don’t think, and never will, that it was necessary to kill him. He’s already proven that he’s willing to make “the sacrifice play”—in almost every movie. The most noticeable example is, of course, when he flew the nuke into the wormhole, fully expecting to die. It proved to Steve, and everyone else, that Tony was a hero, and that he already was more than willing to sacrifice his life to save others. So even though Tony’s death was beautiful, it wasn’t necessary to “finish his character arc.” Retiring and raising children was the natural conclusion to his story, not death.

And I’m making the biggest deal over Tony’s death because he was my favorite character. It’s just a personal preference. I know we lost other characters, I just personally won’t miss them as badly.

It proved to Steve, and everyone else, that Tony was a hero, and that he already was more than willing to sacrifice his life to save others. So even though Tony’s death was beautiful, it wasn’t necessary to “finish his character arc.” Retiring and raising children was the natural conclusion to his story, not death.

And I’m making the biggest deal over Tony’s death because he was my favorite character. It’s just a personal preference. I know we lost other characters, I just personally won’t miss them as badly.

summary: A Blast From The Past? Or Is It The Future?
body:
A Blast From The Past? Or Is It The Future?

Word Count: 1,253

.

This contains tiny endgame spoilers~~

.

Read at your own risk~~

.

Warnings: Spoilers

.

.

    The cool summer breeze blew over the ocean calming Sydney. She let her short light brown hair flow with the wind as she meditated. She smelled the saltiness of the water, feeling the wind bring it up to kiss her cheeks from where she sat on her families dock.

    She couldn’t remember the last time she felt this calm.

           She knew her great grandfather had travelled back in time to stay with her great grandmother, and that most of her memories were messed up. He told her himself since he wanted her to know of his past that was in the future. Sure she could see the resemblance in the history books that she read for fun, but she never really thought of it until he brought it up.

Since her family was one of the smartest thanks to her Great-grandmother she didn’t attend public school, or any school at all really. Sydney Rogers was a mystery to the world just the way her parent’s wanted. Not that she minded all too much; she spent her time reading up on her great-grandfather’s past rendezvous, and all about Tony Stark’s findings in the scientific field, only having access because her Grandpa Steve asked Pepper for the access codes to his files. Pepper allowed it because she figured that someone is gonna need to continue to further Tony’s work and who better than someone that is the descendant of Steve Rogers.

However, Sydney’s relaxation didn’t last long before her father called her for supper, which completely ruined her concentration on the world around her and put her back in a slightly sour mood.

She sighed and pulled herself up from the ground her blue eyes opening as she turned to head inside for dinner.

~~With Sam and Bucky~~

“Buck, there’s no way we can find someone that doesn’t want to be found,” Sam said.

“Well then Steve is just gonna have to tell us now isn’t he?” Bucky asked as he barged into Steve’s room. “

“I couldn’t stop him,” Sam warned Steve.

“So tell me who Anthony and Sydney Rogers are, and why you didn’t tell us you had a grandson and great-granddaughter sooner,” Bucky demanded.

Steve raised an eyebrow at Bucky noting his attitude. “My grandson asked me to keep him and his family out of all the ‘crazy.’ The most he has asked of me is that I get access to Tony’s files for his daughter to study since she’s gotten bored learning all she can about history.”

“Ok but where are they?” Sam asked.

“I honestly don’t remember I haven’t been there in a very long time. You could ask Peter, I know he and Sydney have been pen-pals. Sydney said she wanted to learn more about his spider powers,” Steve said.

“So you’re telling us that your great-granddaughter is some kinda Tony Stark super genius?” Sam asked.

“Yeah really,” Bucky said.

“I’m not sure what she is, but what I do know is that Pepper has given up a lot of money to let Sydney become the new Tony Stark,” Steve said.

“Well I guess it’s time to go find Parker,” Sam said. Bucky nodded and they bid their farewells to Steve and headed to the small apartment in Queens.

Once the two arrived Peter’s Aunt May answered the door and let them go see Peter who was in his room.

“Oh, Mr. Bucky, Mr. Sam w-what are you doing here?” Peter asked hiding the piece of paper he was writing on.

“What are you trying to hide Peter?” Sam asked

“Nothing!”

“Are you writing to Sydney?” Bucky asked.

“H-how did you know?” He asked.

“We asked Steve about Sydney, and her father,” Sam said. Peter nodded.

“We’re going to find her,” Bucky said. “So what’s her address?”

“Oh uh its 04 Freedom Drive in upstate New York,” Peter said already planning on going there today.

“I’m not surprised,” Sam rolled his eyes.

“I was planning on going there anyway you’re welcome to join me. She just wanted notes on the progression of my powers,” Peter said smiling grabbing his backpack and the piece of paper.

The three drove up to Sydney’s house, and they were greeted by a fairly normal house other than the fact that it looked like a mansion. Peter smiled and ran up to the door knocking just like he normally does on the weekends.

“Who is it?” A soft female voice asked.

“Peter Parker.”

The door swung open and revealed a short girl, around five foot two, with bright blue eyes, short light brown hair, thick rimmed glasses and a small smile on her face. What shocked the two older men was the fact that her father stood not too far behind her, and he looked just like Steve post-serum.

Sydney pulled Peter into the house rushing him to her lab in the basement leaving her father to deal with the two grown men that stood on the porch.

“What can I do for you two?” Her father asked.

“Uh sir we’re just wondering if we could speak to your daughter,” Sam said.

“Why?” He asked.

“You see since the Avengers are a bit sparse these days we wanted to speak to her about joining. Not for combat, but for helping develop new gear, and organizing missions,” Sam continued.

“Come in, I’ll speak to you about this. My name is Anthony by the way,” He said.

“James, but you can call me Bucky.”

“Samuel, but I prefer Sam.”

As the adults talked Peter and Sydney were calmly setting him up on her scanner. She was typing while he put on the two bracelets that had wires coming off of them.

“So how’s all of his files treating you?” Peter asked.

“Great! I know its sad that he’s gone, but I love learning everything I can from him,” she said smiling. Peter smiled watching her spin around in her lab chair to her big computer.

“Alright, scan commencing in 5… 4… 3… 2… 1…” she pointed to him and he felt a tiny shock in both wrists and then everything was done. “Alright, cool we’re done. Thanks so much Peter! I know you don’t want many people to know you’re Spiderman so this really means a lot.”

The three men that were conversing upstairs came down to see Sydney and she was pulling out a microchip to give to Peter.

“I developed something that Mr. Stark had planned in a backup file for after the fight. I hope you like it cuz this is the only way for me to thank you. I already installed it in Ms. Potts house for her and Morgan so come here,” she said waving him over.

    The cool summer breeze blew over the ocean calming Sydney. She let her short light brown hair flow with the wind as she meditated. She smelled the saltiness of the water, feeling the wind bring it up to kiss her cheeks from where she sat on her families dock.

    She couldn’t remember the last time she felt this calm.

           She knew her great grandfather had travelled back in time to stay with her great grandmother, and that most of her memories were messed up. He told her himself since he wanted her to know of his past that was in the future. Sure she could see the resemblance in the history books that she read for fun, but she never really thought of it until he brought it up.

Since her family was one of the smartest thanks to her Great-grandmother she didn’t attend public school, or any school at all really. Sydney Rogers was a mystery to the world just the way her parent’s wanted. Not that she minded all too much; she spent her time reading up on her great-grandfather’s past rendezvous, and all about Tony Stark’s findings in the scientific field, only having access because her Grandpa Steve asked Pepper for the access codes to his files. Pepper allowed it because she figured that someone is gonna need to continue to further Tony’s work and who better than someone that is the descendant of Steve Rogers.

However, Sydney’s relaxation didn’t last long before her father called her for supper, which completely ruined her concentration on the world around her and put her back in a slightly sour mood.

She sighed and pulled herself up from the ground her blue eyes opening as she turned to head inside for dinner.

~~With Sam and Bucky~~

“Buck, there’s no way we can find someone that doesn’t want to be found,” Sam said.

“Well then Steve is just gonna have to tell us now isn’t he?” Bucky asked as he barged into Steve’s room. “

“I couldn’t stop him,” Sam warned Steve.

“So tell me who Anthony and Sydney Rogers are, and why you didn’t tell us you had a grandson and great-granddaughter sooner,” Bucky demanded.

Steve raised an eyebrow at Bucky noting his attitude. “My grandson asked me to keep him and his family out of all the ‘crazy.’ The most he has asked of me is that I get access to Tony’s files for his daughter to study since she’s gotten bored learning all she can about history.”

“Ok but where are they?” Sam asked.

“I honestly don’t remember I haven’t been there in a very long time. You could ask Peter, I know he and Sydney have been pen-pals. Sydney said she wanted to learn more about his spider powers,” Steve said.

“So you’re telling us that your great-granddaughter is some kinda Tony Stark super genius?” Sam asked.

“Yeah really,” Bucky said.

“I’m not sure what she is, but what I do know is that Pepper has given up a lot of money to let Sydney become the new Tony Stark,” Steve said.

“Well I guess it’s time to go find Parker,” Sam said. Bucky nodded and they bid their farewells to Steve and headed to the small apartment in Queens.

Once the two arrived Peter’s Aunt May answered the door and let them go see Peter who was in his room.

“Oh, Mr. Bucky, Mr. Sam w-what are you doing here?” Peter asked hiding the piece of paper he was writing on.

“What are you trying to hide Peter?” Sam asked

“Nothing!”

“Are you writing to Sydney?” Bucky asked.

“H-how did you know?” He asked.

“We asked Steve about Sydney, and her father,” Sam said. Peter nodded.

“We’re going to find her,” Bucky said. “So what’s her address?”

“Oh uh its 04 Freedom Drive in upstate New York,” Peter said already planning on going there today.

“I’m not surprised,” Sam rolled his eyes.

“I was planning on going there anyway you’re welcome to join me. She just wanted notes on the progression of my powers,” Peter said smiling grabbing his backpack and the piece of paper.

The three drove up to Sydney’s house, and they were greeted by a fairly normal house other than the fact that it looked like a mansion. Peter smiled and ran up to the door knocking just like he normally does on the weekends.

“Who is it?” A soft female voice asked.

“Peter Parker.”

The door swung open and revealed a short girl, around five foot two, with bright blue eyes, short light brown hair, thick rimmed glasses and a small smile on her face. What shocked the two older men was the fact that her father stood not too far behind her, and he looked just like Steve post-serum.

Sydney pulled Peter into the house rushing him to her lab in the basement leaving her father to deal with the two grown men that stood on the porch.

“What can I do for you two?” Her father asked.

“Uh sir we’re just wondering if we could speak to your daughter,” Sam said.

“Why?” He asked.

“You see since the Avengers are a bit sparse these days we wanted to speak to her about joining. Not for combat, but for helping develop new gear, and organizing missions,” Sam continued.

“Come in, I’ll speak to you about this. My name is Anthony by the way,” He said.

“James, but you can call me Bucky.”

“Samuel, but I prefer Sam.”

As the adults talked Peter and Sydney were calmly setting him up on her scanner. She was typing while he put on the two bracelets that had wires coming off of them.

“So how’s all of his files treating you?” Peter asked.

“Great! I know its sad that he’s gone, but I love learning everything I can from him,” she said smiling. Peter smiled watching her spin around in her lab chair to her big computer.

“Alright, scan commencing in 5… 4… 3… 2… 1…” she pointed to him and he felt a tiny shock in both wrists and then everything was done. “Alright, cool we’re done. Thanks so much Peter! I know you don’t want many people to know you’re Spiderman so this really means a lot.”

The three men that were conversing upstairs came down to see Sydney and she was pulling out a microchip to give to Peter.

“I developed something that Mr. Stark had planned in a backup file for after the fight. I hope you like it cuz this is the only way for me to thank you. I already installed it in Ms. Potts house for her and Morgan so come here,” she said waving him over.

“Can I see your suit?” Peter handed her his suit and she pulled out Karen’s chip and replaced it with the new one.

“Try it out,” she said. Peter took the garment and stepped in letting the mech suit form to his body.

“Hey kid,”

“No way….” Peter trailed off covering, what would be, his mouth.

The three adults watched. Her father was smiling proudly, while Sam and Bucky watched in shock. They hadn’t thought that she would be this advanced when they first found out about her, but this was just on a different scale.

body:
Stephen: I’m prettier.

Tony: No, I am.

Thor: You’re a love deprived old man that’s what you are.

Stephen: Yeah Tony, see? Even Thor agrees.

Thor: Dude I was talking about you-

Stephen: WHAT???

Tony: PPPFFF!!!

Stephen: BUT I’M LIKE…15 YEARS YOUNGER THAN TONY?

Thor: Yeah but…

Tony and Thor at the same time: White hair.

Stephen: BUT MY HAIR IS LIKE THIS SINCE I’M 22-

Thor: White hair.

Tony: *just nods ironically*
